alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 10:47AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, Los Angeles and Ventura. * WHEN...Until 300 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Local ponding of water on roads is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy showers moving into eastern Ventura and western Los Angeles County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Camarillo, Fillmore, Malibu, Agoura Hills, Woodland Hills, Chatsworth, Northridge, Encino, Van Nuys, Santa Monica, Venice, Moorpark, Westlake Village, Malibu Creek State Park, Calabasas and Newbury Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars.
